intro: Ammolirion cappadocicum, commonly known as the Cappadocian bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
